official-title.#text:
To require a demonstration program on the accession as Air Force officers of candidates with
			 auditory impairments.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text: Demonstration program on accession of candidates with auditory impairments as air force officers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall carry out a demonstration program to assess the
			 feasibility and advisability of permitting individuals with auditory
			 impairments (including deafness) to access as officers of the Air Force.

text.#text: Beginning not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

The total number of individuals with auditory impairments who may participate in the demonstration
			 program shall be not fewer than 15 individuals or more than 20
			 individuals.

The individuals who participate in the demonstration program shall include individuals who are deaf
			 and individuals who have a range of other auditory impairments.

header.#text: Mix and range of auditory impairments

text.#text:
Any individual who is chosen to participate in the demonstration program shall meet all essential
			 qualifications for accession as an officer in the Air Force, other than
			 those related to having an auditory impairment.
The

publicize the demonstration program nationally, including to individuals who have auditory
			 impairments and would be otherwise qualified for officer training;
create a process whereby interested individuals can apply for the demonstration program; and

select the participants for the demonstration program, from among the pool of applicants, based on
			 the criteria in

Participants selected for the demonstration program shall be individuals who have not previously
			 served as officers in the Air Force.

header.#text: No prior service as air force officers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the Basic Officer Training course or the Commissioned
			 Officer Training course at Maxwell Air Force Base, Alabama.

text.#text: The participants in the demonstration program shall undergo, at the election of the

Once individuals begin participating in the demonstration program, each Basic Officer Training
			 course or Commissioned Officer Training course at Maxwell Air Force Base,
			 Alabama, shall include not fewer than 4, or more than 6, participants in
			 the demonstration program until all participants have completed such
			 training.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall ensure that participants in the demonstration program have the
			 necessary auxiliary aids and services (as that term is defined in

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
) in
			 order to fully participate in the demonstration program.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section
			 4 of the Americans With Disabilities Act of 1990

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall designate a special advisor to the demonstration program to
			 act as a resource for participants in the demonstration program, as well
			 as a liaison between participants in the demonstration program and those
			 providing the officer training.

text.#text: The
The special advisor shall be a member of the Armed Forces on active duty—
who—
if a commissioned officer, shall be in grade O–3 or higher; or
if an enlisted member, shall be in grade E–5 or higher; and

who is knowledgeable about issues involving, and accommodations for, individuals with auditory
			 impairments (including deafness).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may assign to facilitate the success of the demonstration
			 program and participants.

text.#text:
The special advisor shall be responsible for facilitating the officer training for participants in
			 the demonstration program, intervening and resolving issues and
			 accommodations during the training, and such other duties as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit to the appropriate committees of

a report on
			 the demonstration program. The report shall include the following:

text.#text: Not later than two years after the date of the enactment of this Act, the
A description of the demonstration program and the participants in the demonstration program.
The outcome of the demonstration program, including—

the number of participants in the demonstration program that successfully completed the Basic
			 Officer Training course or the Commissioned Officer Training course;

the number of participants in the demonstration program that were recommended for continued
			 military service;
the issues that were encountered during the program; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
considers
			 appropriate to increase further inclusion of individuals with auditory
			 disabilities serving as officers in the Air Force or other Armed Forces.

text.#text: such recommendation for modifications to the demonstration program as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
considers
			 appropriate in light of the demonstration program.
